description.value:
The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can constrict only once.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d6 type=poison average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage, and the target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained}, and the yuan-ti can’t constrict another target.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Shapechanger. The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It doesn’t change form if it dies.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only). The yuan-ti’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: animal friendship (snakes only), eldritch blast (2 beams; +5 to hit; [[/damage + 13 type=force average=true]] damage per beam), minor &Reference[ill]{illusion}, and &Reference[poison]{poison} spray

3/day: suggestion

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Malison Type. The yuan-ti has one of the following types:

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Type 1: Human body with snake head

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Type 2: Human head and body with snakes for arms

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Type 3: Human head and upper body with a serpentine lower body instead of legs

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Special Notes: snakes only.

This spell lets you convince a &Reference[beast]{beast} that you mean it no harm. Choose a &Reference[beast]{beast} that you can see within range. It must see and hear you. If the beast's &Reference[int]{Intelligence} is 4 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the &Reference[beast]{beast} must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by you for the spell's duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional &Reference[beast]{beast} for each slot level above 1st.

Special Notes: 2 beams; +5 to hit; 1d10 + 3 force damage per beam.

A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 &Reference[force]{force} damage.

The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

items.name: Eldritch Blast (2 beams; +5 to hit; 1d10 + 3 force damage per beam)

description.value:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The &Reference[ill]{illusion} also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object--such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest--it must be no larger than a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the &Reference[ill]{illusion} becomes faint to the creature.

You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can't be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.

edgeCases.name: eldritch blast
edgeCases.edge: 2 beams; +5 to hit; 1d10 + 3 force damage per beam
